title: Understanding the Zero Exponent Rule
text: The zero exponent rule states that any number or expression raised to the power of $$0$$ is equal to $$1$$.

title: Applying the Zero Exponent Rule
text: When simplifying expressions, check for any terms with an exponent of $$0$$. These simplify directly to $$1$$.

title: Identify Terms with Zero Exponent
text: Look for terms where $${\left({de}^2\right)}^{11}$$ is divided by itself. This simplifies to $$\frac{{\left({de}^2\right)}^{11}}{{\left({de}^2\right)}^{11}}$$.

title: Consider Other Parts of Expression
text: After simplifying using the zero exponent rule, there may be other parts of the expression to consider, such as coefficients or other grouped terms.

title: Simplify Additional Elements
text: Recognize that $$\frac{{\left({de}^2\right)}^{11}}{{\left({de}^2\right)}^{11}}$$ simplifies to $$1$$, and only $$2$$ remains as the denominator in the expression $$\frac{{2\left({de}^2\right)}^{11}}{{\left({de}^2\right)}^{11}}$$.
